Sure, here is a table that summarizes some of the common real-world applications and the implementation mechanism of a convolutional bidirectional LSTM (convBILSTM) network:

| Application | Description | Implementation |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Image Captioning | Generating a natural language description of an image. | A convolutional layer is used to extract features from the image, a bidirectional LSTM layer is used to generate the captions, and an attention mechanism is used to focus on the relevant parts of the image. |
| Video Action Recognition | Recognizing actions in a video. | A convolutional layer is used to extract features from the video frames, a bidirectional LSTM layer is used to capture the temporal dependencies, and a fully connected layer is used to make predictions. |
| Text-to-Speech | Generating speech from text. | A convolutional layer is used to extract features from the text, a bidirectional LSTM layer is used to generate the speech, and a sequence-to-sequence architecture is used to map the text to the speech. |
| Speech Recognition | Recognizing speech from audio. | A convolutional layer is used to extract features from the audio, a bidirectional LSTM layer is used to capture the temporal dependencies, and a fully connected layer is used to make predictions. |
